properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters of Swain's Island; Coastal waters of Manua; Coastal waters of Tututila and Aunuu
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 14 at 6:11PM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
Gale force winds are expected to impact American Samoa coastal
waters as early as Saturday night or Sunday morning. The gale
force winds are expected to then continue through Tuesday.

A possible developing tropical cyclone embedded within an active
monsoon trough to the northwest of the Samoa Island Chain, is
anticipated to bring northeast winds of at least 35 knots, with
higher gusts, and seas up to 20 feet. Seas and winds are much
higher near thunderstorms.

Gale force winds and dangerous seas could capsize or damage vessels
and the frequent showers could reduce visibility.

Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible hazardous
conditions. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe wind and seas.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates.

You may also follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website
at www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: A Gale Watch is in effect for American Samoa coastal waters
